page.title: 20HOOK NORTON-TOURISM
page.content: This block is off the main Cotswold/ Stratford tourist track. However there are a growing number of cottages let out to visitors attracted to the peace and unspoilt nature of the area.Besides interest in the Brewery and the old houses of the villages the church at Great Rollright attracts many tourists. It is a smallish church probably built on an earlier pagan site about 500 years ago. Above the door is a Norman archway(Tympanium)beautifully carved to depict the story of Jonah and the Whale.Above the porch was a floor where the priest could hide.On the left of the porch is the oldest window still with the original glass.The oldest part is about 500 years old. The chancel was added l00 years later. The church still has its original rood screen which is very colourful but higher up than it should be. There are 6 bells.
